availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Herman L. Emmons, Jr. (Baltimore, Maryland, soldier and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Baltimore, Maryland, soldier and commissioner of deeds. Pennsylvania native. Married to Jane L. Emmons. Father of Edith M. Emmons. Captain in the 5th New York Volunteer Heavy Artillery from February 1862 to February 1865. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Baltimore in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Maryland, Baltimore, Ward 18, p. 142; ivil War Muster Roll Abstracts of New York State Volunteers, United States Sharpshooters, and United States Colored Troops [ca. 1861-1900]. Microfilm, 1185 rolls. New York State Archives, Albany, New York, Box Number 717, Abstract# 1691 (accessed via ancestry.com).
